function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited guidance for national guidelines on urban greenery for health benefits","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Walking or running in a synthetic environment may convey fewer health benefits compared to a natural environment, potentially impacting public health.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge about the mechanisms underlying the relationship between greenspace and health may limit the ability to optimize health benefits from natural environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Undervaluation of greenspace as a resource for health may lead to underinvestment and underutilization of natural environments for promoting public health.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of subgroup analysis for ses groups in relation to greenspace and health outcomes","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor methodological quality and heterogeneity of outcome measures in previous systematic reviews","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent and mixed findings in relation to the association between greenspace and health outcomes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusivity leading to high heterogeneity across studies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure to greenspace may lead to health benefits","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct meta-analyses for fasting blood glucose, cholesterol, hba1c, asthma, and triglycerides due to lack of high quality studies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to conduct sensitivity analysis due to meta-analyses consisting only of studies scoring \\u2265 9","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to conduct meta-analysis for certain health outcomes such as cancer, respiratory mortality, and neurological outcomes due to lack of comparable results from multiple studies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Statistically nonsignificant results for certain health outcomes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Substantial heterogeneity in study results","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusion of poor quality studies in the meta-analysis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Observational and interventional studies assessed using different checklists, which may lead to inconsistent assessment and comparison of results.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Meta-analysis based on \\'high\\' and \\'low\\' greenspace exposure defined by individual papers\\u2019 highest and lowest categories, which may result in inconsistent categorization and interpretation of exposure levels.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficiently described green space exposure measurement, leading to potential inaccuracies in the assessment of its impact on contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate representativeness of study samples, leading to biased conclusions regarding the impact of green space on contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of valid and reliable tools for assessing participant outcomes related to green space exposure and contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Selection bias in the population","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusion bias in the selection of individuals providing data","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Derivation of green space variable not well described","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"35 cohort studies and 69 cross-sectional studies, including 18 large scale ecological studies, may increase the risk of disease transmission due to the close contact and interactions among participants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessments of quality were initially made by one reviewer and then cross-checked by another, potentially leading to discrepancies in identifying risks of disease transmission in the study environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close interactions and discussions during the consensus process for quality assessments may pose a risk of disease transmission among the individuals involved.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to urban or indoor environments without green spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of greenspace in healthcare settings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Small sample sizes in studies on forest bathing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Recent growth in interest in greenspace and health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Papers and documents not written in english","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in size of populations under investigation","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Authors not presenting required data for meta-analysis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High heterogeneity in study populations, design, and exposure","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Studies with high risk of bias or low quality not excluded from sensitivity analysis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear definition of terms such as \\'neighbourhood environment\\' and \\'built environment\\' may lead to inconsistent inclusion or exclusion of studies related to contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate piloting of data extraction sheet may result in incomplete or inaccurate recording of study details, leading to potential data errors and bias in the synthesis and analysis.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Publication bias or selective reporting in meta-analysis may lead to an inaccurate estimation of the association between greenspace and contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of communicable diseases from the review may overlook the impact of greenspace on disease transmission and propagation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of mental health from the review may neglect the potential mental health benefits of greenspace, impacting overall well-being and quality of life.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through contact with nature and outdoor environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate management of waste and sanitation in greenspaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and education on disease prevention in greenspaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low-income neighborhoods have reduced greenspace availability, leading to lower use of greenspaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Park quality and frequency of park use are higher among high-socioeconomic status ses residents","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Living in a greener neighborhood is linked with stronger greenspace-health associations and lower income-related health inequalities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased access to greenspaces in urban areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between health care providers and local nature partnerships","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid spread of contagious diseases in densely populated areas such as metropolitan contexts and sub-regional realities with widespread urbanization.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty and temporary interventions in the housing sector due to the pandemic, leading to potential disruptions in the sharing economy and real estate market.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"}]}
